#Text=Wikinews Shorts : November 13 , 2008
#Text=A compilation of brief news reports for
#Text=Thursday , November 13 , 2008 .
#Text=Contribute to Wikinews by expanding these briefs or add a new one .
#Text=Study shows that carrying excess fat around waist increases risk of early death
#Text=A new study has found that people storing extra fat around their waist have a strongly increased chance of early death , even if their overall weight is average .
#Text=The study , published in the New England Journal of Medicine today , found that for each addition 5cm on the waist , the chance of early death is increased by between 13 % and 17 % .
#Text=In the study , 360,000 people from across nine countries in Europe were surveyed .
#Text=One of the study 's authors , Professor Elio Riboli of Imperial College London , commented on the findings .
#Text=" We were surprised to see the waist size having such a powerful effect on people 's health and premature death , " he stated .
#Text=Sources
#Text=" ' Love handles ' raise death risk " — BBC News Online , November 13 , 2008
#Text=Ian Sample .
#Text=" Waist , not just weight , shows risk of premature death , study says " — The Guardian , November 13 , 2008
#Text=Tobias Pischon et al .
#Text=" Abstract : General and Abdominal Adiposity and Risk of Death in Europe " — New England Journal of Medicine , November 13 , 2008

column1: #Text=EU abolishes rules banning oddly-shaped fruit

#Text=The European Commission , the executive branch of the European Union , has today lifted its ban on unusually shaped fruits and vegetables , in what the EU 's agriculture commissioner has called " a new dawn for the curvy cucumber and the knobbly carrot " .
#Text=The regulation has previously been criticized as an example of the EU 's bureaucracy by critics of the organisation .

#Text=The products affected by the deregulation are apricots , artichokes , asparagus , aubergines , avocadoes , beans , Brussels sprouts , carrots , cauliflowers , cherries , courgettes , cucumbers , cultivated mushrooms , garlic , hazelnuts in shell , headed cabbage , leeks , melons , onions , peas , plums , ribbed celery , spinach , walnuts in shell , water melons and witloof/chicory .
#Text=Sources
#Text=" EU slices up ' ugly fruit ' rules " — BBC News Online , November 13 , 2008
#Text=" Europe Relaxes Rules on Sale of Ugly Fruits and Vegetables " — New York Times , November 13 , 2008

column1: #Text=Vase bought for £1 sells for £32,450
#Text=A vase purchased at a car boot sale for £ 1 has sold for £32,450 , following advice from experts on the BBC 's Antiques Roadshow television program .
#Text=The vase was sold in an auction at Christie ’s .
#Text=The vase was found to be a 1929 work made by the French designer Rene Lalique .
#Text=Sources
#Text=" Car boot sale vase nets £32,450 " — BBC News Online , November 13 , 2008
#Text=" £32,449 profit for car boot sale vase by Lalique " — Times Online , November 13 , 2008

column1: #Text=Blackwater may pay financial penalties for improper arms shipments
#Text=Recent anonymous press briefings by US State Department officials indicated that its arms control division may punish Blackwater Worldwide for improper paperwork .
#Text=The Directorate of Defense Trade Controls has the power to fine or agree voluntary penalties with exporters of certain weapons , who do not follow correct procedures .
#Text=Blackwater Worldwide , a private military company , exported automatic weapons to Iraq that became the subject of a federal investigation first disclosed in 2007 .
#Text=Concern was expressed by the unnamed officials that paperwork errors may make the weapons untraceable , and that some reached Iraq 's black market .
#Text=Sources
#Text=" Blackwater Faces Millions in Fines for Weapons Shipments ( radio show transcript ) " — Democracy Now ! , November 13 , 2008
#Text=Knight Ridder / McClatchy Newspapers .
#Text=" Blackwater faces Fines over Arms Deal " — Military.com , November 13 , 2008
#Text=Dan Friedman , Congress Daily .
#Text=" Blackwater could face sanctions for improper arms shipments " — Government Executive , November 7 , 2008
